mil.emp3.api

Class LookAt

  • java.lang.Object
    • mil.emp3.api.LookAt
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ILookAt, IGeoAltitudeMode, IGeoBase, IGeoLookAt, IGeoPosition

    public class LookAt
extends java.lang.Object
implements ILookAt
    This class implements a LookAt object which can be set on the map. It encapsulates a GeoLookA. Once a look at object is created and set on at least one map, the apply method must be called after the values have been change in order to change the maps view.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.cmapi.primitives.IGeoAltitudeMode

      • setGeoId

        public void setGeoId(java.util.UUID uuid)
        Description copied from interface: IGeoBase
        The id value should be a UUID (see https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc4122.txt) to avoid conflict of data from multiple sources. All id values SHALL be unique regardless of type and conflicting id values will be treated as the same element. Once this ID is set, it should not be changed to avoid refernces by ID to break. The setter is provided so that an item can be deserialized from an object with an exisitng ID or provided an exisiting ID immediately after instantiation.
        Specified by:
        setGeoId in interface IGeoBase

      • getGeoId

        public java.util.UUID getGeoId()
        This method retrieves the lookAts unique identifier.
        Specified by:
        getGeoId in interface IGeoBase
        Returns:
        a UUID. See UUID

      • setDataProviderId

        public void setDataProviderId(java.lang.String s)
        Description copied from interface: IGeoBase
        This is a free form string that can represent an ID specific to this piece of data as it is tracked uniquely by the system providing this data. This is different from GeoId as the GeoId is of type UUID. Some systems may use IDs formatted in a way that it cannot be stored in a UUID. In this case, this property can be used by the system to track this psece of data by the ID they use internally. The GeoID proerty will be used by CMAPI as the unique ID and this ID is for the benefit of the system providing the data.
        Specified by:
        setDataProviderId in interface IGeoBase

      • getDataProviderId

        public java.lang.String getDataProviderId()
        Specified by:
        getDataProviderId in interface IGeoBase

      • getProperties

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getProperties()
        Description copied from interface: IGeoBase
        A key value pair where both the key and value where the key is a unique string and the value is an object that can be stored as and read from a string. In cases where an IGeoBase will be serialized all of the values will be serialized using the objects toString() method. It is the resposibility of the applications accessing values stored in the properties hash map to determine if the value is in a string format and convert back to whatever object type the string was derived from. The object should not contain any references to other objects where that relationship is expected to exist beyond copying a current value of a simple type as the relationship will not be properly restored when deserialization occurs. CMAPI will not use the properties hash for any internal purpose, it will simply allow 3rd party data to pass additional attributes that will stay associated with the CMAPI object as it moves between applications and systems.
        Specified by:
        getProperties in interface IGeoBase

      • apply

        public void apply(boolean animate)
        Description copied from interface: ILookAt
        This method causes any changes done to the LookAt settings to be applied to any map or object that it may be associated with.
        Specified by:
        apply in interface ILookAt
        Parameters:
        animate - If set to true then camera movement will be animated.
